ualberta.g12.adventurecreator

Interface FController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FragmentController

    public interface FController
    Control of data in the Fragment model. Controls fragment modifications within the selected fragment. Allows the user to add, delete or edit an illustration, text or a choice to the current fragment.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChoice(Fragment frag, Choice cho)
      Adds a choice to the list of choices that a fragment has
      void addEmptyPart(Fragment frag)
      Adds an empty FragmentPart to the fragment (for editing purposes only)
      boolean addIllustration(Fragment frag, java.lang.String illustration, int dispNum)
      Adds illustration to a fragment at specified position
      boolean addTextSegment(Fragment frag, java.lang.String textSegment, int dispNum)
      Adds textSegment to a fragment at specified position
      void deleteFragmentPart(Fragment frag, int partNum)
      removes the FragmentPart specified by its partNum (it's number in the displayorder) from the fragment
      void editTitle(Fragment frag, java.lang.String newTitle)
      Edits the title of the fragment
      void removeEmptyPart(Fragment frag)
      removes empty FragmentPart from the fragment (for editing purposes only)

    • Method Detail

      • editTitle

        void editTitle(Fragment frag,
             java.lang.String newTitle)
        Edits the title of the fragment
        Parameters:
        frag - is the Fragment to be changed
        newTitle - the new title of the fragment

      • addTextSegment

        boolean addTextSegment(Fragment frag,
                     java.lang.String textSegment,
                     int dispNum)
        Adds textSegment to a fragment at specified position
        Parameters:
        frag - is the Fragment to be changed
        textSegment - is the textSegment to add to the fragment
        dispNum - is position that the textSegment will be inserted

      • removeEmptyPart

        void removeEmptyPart(Fragment frag)
        removes empty FragmentPart from the fragment (for editing purposes only)
        Parameters:

      • deleteFragmentPart

        void deleteFragmentPart(Fragment frag,
                      int partNum)
        removes the FragmentPart specified by its partNum (it's number in the displayorder) from the fragment
        Parameters:
        frag - is the Fragment to be changed
        partNum - the fragmentPart number of the fragmentPart in the display order to be removed
